info.title: PlayFab Economy API
info.description: API methods for managing User Generated Content. API methods for managing the catalog. Inventory manages in-game assets for any given entity.

post.description: Create a bundle
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, and bundle details, create a bundle.

post.description: Creates a new item in the working catalog using provided metadata.
post.x-requestDetails: The item will not be published to the public catalog until the PublishItem API is called for the item.

post.description: Create a store
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, and store details, create a store.

post.description: Create a subscription
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, and subscription details, create a subscription

post.description: Creates one or more upload URLs which can be used by the client to upload raw file data.
post.x-requestDetails: Upload URLs point to Azure Blobs; clients must follow the Microsoft Azure Storage Blob Service REST API pattern for uploading content. The response contains upload URLs and IDs for each file. The IDs and URLs returned must be added to the item metadata and commited using the CreateDraftItem or UpdateDraftItem Item APIs.

post.description: Delete a bundle by friendly Id
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type and Friendly Id, delete a bundle.

post.description: Delete a bundle by Id
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type and Id, delete a bundle.

post.description: Removes an item from working catalog and all published versions from the public catalog.
Delete a store by friendly Id
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type and friendly Id, delete a store.

post.description: Delete a store by Id
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type and Id, delete a store.

post.description: Delete a subscription by friendly Id
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type and friendly Id, delete a subscription.

post.description: Delete a subscription by Id
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type and Id, delete a subscription.

post.description: Get a bundle by Friendly Id
post.x-requestDetails: Retrieves the specified bundle by friendly Id.

post.description: Get a bundle by Id
post.x-requestDetails: Retrieves the specified bundle by Id.

post.description: Get a bundle by marketplace offer Id
post.x-requestDetails: Retrieves the specified bundle by marketplace offer Id.

post.description: Retrieves an item from the working catalog. This item represents the current working state of the catalog item.
Retrieves a paginated list of the items from the draft catalog.
Retrieves an item from the public catalog.
Gets the status of a publish of an item.
Get a store by Friendly Id
post.x-requestDetails: Retrieves the specified store by FriendlyId.

post.description: Get a store by Id
post.x-requestDetails: Retrieves the specified store by Id.

post.description: Get a subscription by Friendly Id
post.x-requestDetails: Retrieves the specified subscription by FriendlyId.

post.description: Get a subscription by Id
post.x-requestDetails: Retrieves the specified subscription by Id.

post.description: Get a subscription by marketplace offer Id
post.x-requestDetails: Retrieves the specified subscription by MarketplaceOfferId.

post.description: Initiates a publish of an item from the working catalog to the public catalog.
post.x-requestDetails: The call kicks off a workflow to publish the item to the public catalog. The Publish Status API should be used to monitor the publish job.

post.description: Purchase an item, bundle or subscription by friendly id.
post.x-requestDetails: Purchase a single item, bundle or subscription by friendly id, paying the associated price.

post.description: Purchase an item, bundle or subscription by id.
post.x-requestDetails: Purchase a single item, bundle or subscription by id, paying the associated price.

post.description: Execute a search against the public catalog using the provided search parameters and returns a set of paginated results.
Execute a search against the set of all bundles, using the provided search parameters and returns a set of paginated results
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, search text and/or (filter, orderby, skip, top and ExpandReferencedItems), search for bundles.

post.description: Execute a search against the set of all stores, using the provided search parameters and returns a set of paginated results
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, search text and/or (filter, orderby, skip, top and ExpandReferencedItems), search for stores.

post.description: Execute a search against the set of all subscriptions, using the provided search parameters and returns a set of paginated results
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, search text and/or (filter, orderby, skip, top and ExpandReferencedItems), search for subscriptions.

post.description: Update a bundle
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, and bundle details, update a bundle.

post.description: Update the metadata for an item in the working catalog.
Update a store
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, and store details, update a store.

post.description: Update a subscription
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type and subscription details, update a subscription.

post.description: Increase virtual currencies amount.
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will increase the entity's currencies by a specific amount.

post.description: Check the status of a transfer all request
post.x-requestDetails: Check the status of a transfer all with a transfer ticket Id

post.description: Consume inventory items.
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will consume the specified inventory items.

post.description: Get current inventory items.
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will get the entity's inventory items.

post.description: Get current virtual currencies.
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will get the entity's virtual currencies.

post.description: Grant inventory items.
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will grant the specified inventory items.

post.description: Set inventory items
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will set the entity's inventory items

post.description: Set virtual currencies
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will set the entity's currencies to a specific amount.

post.description: Decrease virtual currencies amount.
post.x-requestDetails: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will decrease the entity's currencies by a specific amount.

post.description: Transfer all assets
post.x-requestDetails: Transfer all assets from an entity's container Id to another entity's container Id.

post.description: Transfer inventory items.
post.x-requestDetails: Transfer the specified inventory items of an entity's container Id to another entity's container Id.

post.description: Transfer virtual currencies.
post.x-requestDetails: Transfer the specified virtual currencies amount of an entity's container Id to another entity's container Id.

post.description: Update inventory Items.
post.x-requestDetails: Update the specified inventory items.

post.description: Creates a new community catalog item in the working catalog using provided metadata.
post.x-requestDetails: The item will not be published to the public catalog until the user makes a call to the PublishItem API.

post.description: Creates or updates a review for the specified User Generated Content.
Creates one or more upload URLs which can be used by the client to upload raw mod file data.
post.x-requestDetails: Upload URLs point to Azure Blobs; clients must follow the Microsoft Azure Storage Blob Service REST API pattern for uploading content. The response contains upload URLs and IDs for each file. The IDs and URLs returned must be added to the item metadata and commited using the CreateDraftItem or UpdateDraftItem Item APIs.

post.description: Removes an item from working catalog and all published versions from the public catalog.
Retrieves an item from the working catalog. This item represents the current working state of the community item.
Retrieves a paginated list of the items created by a user.
Get a paginated set of reviews associated with the specified User Generated Content.
Get a summary of all reviews associated with the specified User Generated Content.
Gets the submitted review for the specifed item by the authenticated user.
Retrieves an item from the public catalog.
Gets the configuration for the user generated content catalog.
Gets the status of a publish of an item.
Initiates a publish of a item from the working catalog to the public catalog.
post.x-requestDetails: The call kicks off a workflow to publish the item to the public catalog. The Publish Status API should be used to monitor the publish job.

post.description: Gets the configuration for the user generated content catalog.
Submit a vote for a review, indicating whether the review was helpful or unhelpful.
Update the metadata for an item in the working catalog.

ApiErrorWrapper.description: The basic wrapper around every failed API response

code.description: Numerical HTTP code

status.description: String HTTP code

errorDetails.description: Detailed description of individual issues with the request object

AddVirtualCurrenciesRequest.description: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will increase the entity's currencies by a specific amount.

ContainerId.description: The Container Id to perform this action on. (Default="default")

Currencies.description: A list of currencies to modify

Entity.description: The entity to perform this action on.

IdempotencyId.description: The Idempotency Id for this request
The Idempotency Id for this request

AlternateIds.description: The alternate IDs associated with this item.

Contents.description: The set of contents associated with this item.

ContentType.description: The client-defined type of the item.

CreationDate.description: The date and time when this item was created.

CreatorEntityKey.description: The ID of the creator of this catalog item.

Description.description: A dictionary of localized descriptions. Key is language code and localized string is the value. The neutral locale is required.

DisplayProperties.description: Game specific properties for display purposes. This is an arbitrary JSON blob.

ETag.description: The current ETag value that can be used for optimistic concurrency in the If-None-Match header.

Id.description: The unique ID of the catalog item.

Images.description: The images associated with this item. Images can be thumbnails or screenshots.

IsHidden.description: Indicates if the item is hidden

ItemReferences.description: The item references associated with this item.

LastModifiedDate.description: The date and time this item was last updated.

Platforms.description: The platforms supported by this item.

StartDate.description: The date of when the item will be available. If not provided then the product will appear immediately.

Tags.description: The list of tags that are associated with this item.

Title.description: A dictionary of localized titles. Key is language code and localized string is the value. The neutral locale is required.

Amount.description: The amount of the catalog item.

Id.description: The unique ID of the catalog item.

Price.description: The price of the catalog item.

Sort.description: Sort setting of the catalog item.

Amount.description: The amount of the catalog price.

CurrencyId.description: The currency ID of the catalog price.

Amounts.description: The amounts of the catalog item price.

Entity.description: The entity to perform this action on.

Filter.description: An OData filter used to refine the search query.

OrderBy.description: An OData orderBy used to order the results of the search query.

Select.description: An OData select query option used to augment the search results. If not defined, the default search result metadata will be returned.

Skip.description: The number of results to skip.

TitleId.description: The ID of the title that this catalog item is associated with.

Top.description: The number of results to retrieve.

Count.description: The total count of hits for the search query.

Items.description: The paginated set of results for the search query.

CreateUploadUrlsRequest.description:
Upload URLs point to Azure Blobs; clients must follow the Microsoft Azure Storage Blob Service REST
                API pattern for uploading content. The response contains upload URLs and IDs for each file. The IDs and URLs
                returned must be added to the item metadata and commited using the CreateDraftItem or UpdateDraftItem Item APIs.

Entity.description: The entity to perform this action on.

Files.description: Description of the files to be uploaded by the client.

UploadUrls.description: Urls and metadata for the files to be uploaded by the client.

PublishItemRequest.description:
The call kicks off a workflow to publish the item to the public catalog.
                The Publish Status API should be used to monitor the publish job.

Entity.description: The entity to perform this action on.

ETag.description: ETag of the catalog item to published from the working catalog to the public catalog. Used for optimistic concurrency. If the provided ETag does not match the ETag in the current working catalog, the request will be reject. If not provided, the current version of the document in the working catalog will be published.

ItemId.description: ID of the catalog item to publish from the working catalog to the public catalog.

Entity.description: The entity to perform this action on.

ItemId.description: ID of the catalog item to publish from the working catalog to the public catalog.

Result.description: High level state of the publish.

StatusMessage.description: Descriptive message about the current status of the publish.

Upload URLs point to Azure Blobs; clients must follow the Microsoft Azure Storage Blob Service REST
                API pattern for uploading content. The response contains upload URLs and IDs for each file. The IDs and URLs
                returned must be added to the item metadata and commited using the CreateDraftItem or UpdateDraftItem Item APIs.

GetVirtualCurrenciesRequest.name: GetVirtualCurrenciesRequest
GetVirtualCurrenciesRequest.description: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will get the entity's virtual currencies.

GrantInventoryItemsRequest.name: GrantInventoryItemsRequest
GrantInventoryItemsRequest.description: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will grant the specified inventory items.

PublishItemRequest.name: PublishItemRequest
PublishItemRequest.description:
The call kicks off a workflow to publish the item to the public catalog.
                The Publish Status API should be used to monitor the publish job.

PurchaseItemByFriendlyIdRequest.name: PurchaseItemByFriendlyIdRequest
PurchaseItemByFriendlyIdRequest.description: Purchase item by friendly Id request

SetInventoryItemsRequest.name: SetInventoryItemsRequest
SetInventoryItemsRequest.description: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will set the entity's inventory items

SetVirtualCurrenciesRequest.name: SetVirtualCurrenciesRequest
SetVirtualCurrenciesRequest.description: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will set the entity's currencies to a specific amount.

SubtractVirtualCurrenciesRequest.name: SubtractVirtualCurrenciesRequest
SubtractVirtualCurrenciesRequest.description: Given an entity type, entity identifier and container details, will decrease the entity's currencies by a specific amount.

TransferAllRequest.name: TransferAllRequest
TransferAllRequest.description: Transfer all assets from an entity's container Id to another entity's container Id.

TransferInventoryItemsRequest.name: TransferInventoryItemsRequest
TransferInventoryItemsRequest.description: Transfer the specified inventory items of an entity's container Id to another entity's container Id.

TransferVirtualCurrenciesRequest.name: TransferVirtualCurrenciesRequest
TransferVirtualCurrenciesRequest.description: Transfer the specified virtual currencies amount of an entity's container Id to another entity's container Id.

None.name: None
None.description: This API requires no authentication headers (usually provides one to other calls).

SessionTicket.name: SessionTicket
SessionTicket.description: This API requires a client session ticket, available from any Client Login function.

SecretKey.name: SecretKey
SecretKey.description: This API requires a title secret key, available to title admins, from PlayFab Game Manager.

EntityToken.name: EntityToken
EntityToken.description: This API requires an Entity Session Token, available from the Entity GetEntityToken method.
